alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Far Northwest Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 01 at 11:11AM MST until March 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches except between 3 and 9 inches above 7500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Northwest Plateau, Far Northwest Highlands, Northwest Highlands, West Central Plateau, West Central Mountains, Upper Rio Grande Valley, and Espanola Valley. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Far Northwest Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
